snippet: Former Prime Minister Jaroslaw Kaczynski, known for his blunt comments, is a contender again in Polish politics because of a sagging economy and popular fatigue with the current leader.
abstract: Jaroslaw Kaczynski, Poland's opposition leader and former prime minister, is in midst of makeover and budding comeback, aided by popular fatigue with Prime Min Donald Tusk and lackluster economy; prospect has some worried that Kaczynski, polarizing conservative, will isolate country and damage its international relations and economy.
lead_paragraph: Former Prime Minister Jaroslaw Kaczynski, known for his blunt comments, is a contender again in Polish politics because of a sagging economy and popular fatigue with the current leader.

headline.main: Amid Grief, Ex-Premier Resurfaces in Polish Race
headline.print_headline: Amid Grief, Ex-Premier Resurfaces In Polish Race
